name: professorhazard
text: I'm just gonna come out and say it - Zoolander is a hilarious movie, if for no other reason than the dichotomy between Stiller the Younger and Stiller the Elder.

text: David Bowie's cameo = yay.  Especially the pumped fist when he says "Old school."

text: I just love the label when he shows up.  "David Bowie".

text: "Old school rules."

text: the petrol fight is excellent

name: jollysaintpete
text:
"even models can die in a freak gasoline fight"

probably my favorite quote from the movie

name: i_love_kate
text: Man, I always thought the inability to turn left was pretty much the best thing.

name: afterward
text: Beef says "despite the script," but Ben Stiller actually helped write the movie. If I were a hallucinatory Ben Stiller in that situation, I'd be a little miffed.

text: ooh, I should so lame you for that!

name: semiquaver
text: Actually, it's sensible.  I've chubbied asherdan comments without thinking and then realized later that they were incredibly offensive.

text: Whatchoo talkin' 'bout, 'Picurus?

name: pogo
text: Shit, 'Fessor.

name: atticusonline
text: um...'ogo?

name: pogo
text: That's "'go" to you.  (Replace the first syllable, not the first letter.)

name: vweep
text: Comments like these make Achewood better.

name: hellofyellin
text: Why does Ben Stiller look like the Scarecrow from the Wizard of OZ?

name: stuart
text: I thought it was Herman Munster at first. Still do.

name: terebikun
text: Thank God, I thought I was the only one.

name: pogo
text: Alos looks a little like Tony Perkins in Psycho.

name: greenkoolayd
text: also, lou reed.  also, lux interior.

name: phoenixultima
text: Because he only wishes he had a brain?

name: m1st3rbl4ck
text: oh, snap!

name: petitegitan
text: If Ben Stiller was imprinted on my car seat, I'd sell the car.

name: johnnyrocker
text: Man is anyone else feeling like riding in this car would be like being in the titular room from Stephen King's 1408 ? Because that is the feeling I am getting.

name: redheron
text: you mean the one that is the incredibly scary movie that I had bury my face in my companion's arm because I am a girl and was with a boy and that is how the etiquette is in such situations?

name: carlyle
text: Your etiquette blows

name: jezebel
text: I could never sell a car that appears to have seats that are actually old barber chairs, even with Ben Stiller imprinted on them.  That would be like treasure.

name: deusoma
text: It's not the imprint so much as the fact that the imprint talks that would bother me.

name: rrriles
text: And no one comments on the Northern Exposure alt text? SHAME

name: abendsonnen
text: I agree! I exclaimed "Yes!". I love Northern Exposure. I love Ed.

name: smallberries
text: The Chigliak reference gave me a mental wedgie. Once upon a time I was a Janine Turner (Maggie O'Connell) fanboy, imagining the great life we'd have together as bush pilots. All that was ruined when I discovered she's one of the few "stars" who vote republican, thinks Palin's not a fraud and willingly appears on Fox as a pundit. F'ing politics. Messing w/ my shi*.

name: darkwaffle
text: Beef's last line is so perfectly sinister.

name: taiiga
text: A comment left by taiiga was marked lame too many times and excluded. (marked lame by professorhazard, wittyname, Art-Vader)

name: geozimmdrake
text:
this should absolutely be rated higher.
'make their girlfriends dress like emily dickinson and push them off a cliff???
we'll find out when she gets off at 7???????
this strip is plain amazing.

name: professoryes
text: I love that the phrase "dress like Emily Dickinson" conjures up such a perfect image, because there's no reason for it to.

name: ttagxamm
text: How about the Virgin Mary coffee ring, looking like nothing so much as an old WWI or WWII recruitment poster? Something like this ? Awesome.

name: cailetshadow
text: dannnng...I just got a powerful urge to defend Britain.

name: art-vader
text: the strong arms of Canada has certainly killed a lot of animals for some reason

name: deusoma
text: That eyeliner makes Beef look really, really alert. Like he just drank ten coffees or something.

name: relaxing
text: ring finger / sever flesh and bone / and offer it to me

name: featurelessvoid
text: Not until seven!

name: thegrayhoodie
text: I love Beef's line at the end.  It's so scary-stalker, but he's saying it with conviction.

name: cailetshadow
text: In this episode we find out that a cat's ass does a pretty good impression of Ben Stiller.

name: werthog42
text: Heh heh, "impression." I get it.

text: why does ben stiller look like scarecrow?

text: I'm tempted to draw up a whole list comparing Achewood characters to Northern Exposure characters. Must... resist...
